Package game

Class Item

java.lang.Object
game.Item
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public abstract class Item extends Object implements Serializable
Abstract class for creating interactive items. Define a new item by extending this class and overriding relevant methods.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • serialVersionUID

      public static final long serialVersionUID
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Item

      public Item(String label, String name)
      Creates a new item object with the given description label and item name. A description with the given label must already exist in the Game's map of item descriptions (itemDescs).
      Parameters:
      label - description label
      name - item name

    • Item

      public Item(String name)
      Creates a new item object with the given item name.
      Parameters:
      name - item name

  • Method Details

    • setDesc

      public void setDesc(String label)
      Updates this item's description to the description with the given label. The given label must already exist in the Game's map of item descriptions (itemDescs).
      Parameters:
      label - description label

    • setDesc

      public void setDesc(String label, String desc)
      Adds a new description with the given label to the Game's map of item descriptions (itemDescs) and updates this item's description label.
      Parameters:
      label - description label
      desc - item description

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns this item's name.
      Returns:
      item name

    • look

      public void look()
      Displays this item's description when player looks at this item.

    • look

      public void look(String where)
      Displays a message when the player tries to look at some aspect of the item. Ex. "look behind" or "look under".
      Parameters:
      where - where is the player looking?

    • use

      public void use()
      Displays a generic message when player tries to use this item. Extending classes should override this method if the item can be used.

    • take

      public void take(String command)
      Displays a generic message when player tries to take this item. Extending classes should override this method if the item can be taken.
      Parameters:
      command - command entered by player ("take", "get", or "pick up")

    • move

      public void move(String command)
      Displays a generic message when player tries to move this object. Extending classes should override this method if the item can be moved.
      Parameters:
      command - command entered by player ("move", "push", or "pull")

    • open

      public void open()
      Displays a generic message when player tries to open this object. Extending classes should override this method if the item can be opened.

    • close

      public void close()
      Displays a generic message when player tries to close this object. Extending classes should override this method if the item can be closed.

    • uniqueCommand

      public void uniqueCommand(String command)
      Responds to a command unique to this item if such a command exists. Extending classes should override this method if the item should respond to a unique command.
      Parameters:
      command - command issued by player
